result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Godersky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David L Godersky is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David L Godersky was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-AODA and any counseling / treatment deemed appropriate.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L Godersky

defendant.name: Godersky, David L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant David L Godersky in court with attorney A Ronald Polan.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1. Court examines defendant, finds him guilty and renders sentence. On motion of the State, Ct. 2 dismissed.

Defendant David L Godersky in court with attorney A Ronald Polan.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters not guilty plea. Bail to continue.  Further proceedings scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant David L Godersky in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated he will retain Atty. Ronald Paulin on Friday. Court adjourns plea hearing. Bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David L Godersky in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs additional time to retain counsel. Bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
W/CONDITION: Absolute sobriety,  no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription, no violent contact with J.G.

Defendant David L Godersky in court.  Patricia Clare Bradford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof. Court orders $150 cash bond shall stand w/conditions. Defendant stated he needs additional time to obtain counsel, he is not eligible for the public defender.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
